content: @WG-async-foundations meeting time!
There are no issues to triage today, so let's jump right into updates
On the vision, @nikomatsakis and I have been meeting with some of the roadmap area owners to start fleshing out the initiatives for that area and milestones for each initiative
we're going to start sprints next week, or the following week (I still need to schedule this meeting)
I guess we haven't decided if we should use this or another slot
we should also make sure everyone on that page is listed as being in the working group
the other thing
I'm thinking owners should also be responsible for helping out with "polish" issues (like fixing random bugs)
curious to hear what people think of that
like taking one bug per sprint, or something
How long is a sprint for this?
we're using 2 weeks as a starting point
I think that's a good amount of time personally, but we'll see
my thinking is that the "random bugs" aspect of polish is really a shared team responsibility
That seems reasonable to me
it's not really an initiative like, say, lints or more accurate generator captures
okay
what else
I'll work on getting sprint meetings on the books
Are sprint meetings mostly going to be area owners updating each other on status and next steps?
yes, I think so
Sounds good
there may be some technical discussion since we have everyone there
but it's not the primary goal
anyway, I think that's all of my updates
anything else folks want to talk about?
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
ok, thanks all :wave:
Thanks!
Sorry to revive a finished meeting thread, but I was wondering, are y'all looking for more people to participate in the sprint?
Yeah, I think so! Are there areas you're interested in contributing to?
There's a summary of some of the initiatives at https://rust-lang.github.io/wg-async-foundations/vision/roadmap.html
There are a few, ill take a look closer at each one and come back with a short list!
Sounds good!
I think a lot of these are still pretty nebulous, but we're working on refining them and they'll get refined pretty quickly as we start sprints I imagine.

Ah sounds good!
The most interesting to me are AsyncDrop/scope api (not only because its interesting, but because its affects my current production async code haha), but from following this wg for a few weeks, its unclear where to begin working on that one, so I would need guidance.
Other interesting ones that seem like good intros are ones under polish like must_not_suspend lint
I'm also not as familiar with the AsyncDrop/scope API so I'm afraid I can't help much there, but I agree that the must_not_suspend lint seems like a good starting point.
Ill start reading around on rustc's lint infrastructure
I imagine what we'll want is a type that has an attribute like #[must_not_suspend], sort of like #[must_use], which is what the lint would look for.
there is an RFC for this
@Gus Wynn @eholk https://rust-lang.github.io/rfcs/3014-must-not-suspend-lint.html
